description.narrative:
1. Stakeholders impact: The project is expected to improve access to finance for the MSME sector particularly women owned enterprises and those enterprises in LIS, by earmarking the proceeds towards these segments. It would also support formal job creation by contributing to improvement in economic activity.
2. Market Impact: The funding to LIS will enable greater financial inclusion in these states which are the poorest states in the country with significantly low penetration of financial services. In addition, focused funding towards women owned enterprises will encourage economic participation and empowerment of women. The success of this investment is expected to encourage further market development.

The proposed investment comprises a 3-year senior, secured funding of up to INR5,250M or US$75M to Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Limited (MMFSL or the Company). IFCs investment will support the Micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) including Very Small Enterprises (VSEs) segment in India by helping MMFSL augment its lending program to these enterprises. MSMEs and VSEs includes financing towards agricultural sector and the proposed investment will be on lent primarily to finance a range of agricultural equipment, utility and commercial vehicles. At least 50% of the proceeds are expected to be earmarked towards women owned SMEs including VSEs, and the remaining for growth of these segments in the low-Income states (LIS) of India. In addition, the Company has agreed to allocate an amount equal to 3 times IFCs loan amount from its own balance sheet / other sources of funds to on lend to the MSME segment including VSE in LIS. The company will endeavor to disburse this amount during the period of this loan. MMFSL is a rural focused NBFC, and the financial services arm of the Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M or the parent) group. The Company offers a wide range of customized financial products to address its rural customer requirements. The Companys business lines include vehicle and tractor loans, SME loans as well as fixed deposits products. As of December 31, 2018, MMFSLs AUM stood at INR582B (US$8.3B) and equity at INR103B (US$1.5B). IFC may also mobilize additional funding from other investors for the project.
